sen.j: 漬物（つけもの）とは、野菜（場合によっては魚や動物）などを食塩、酢、糠味噌、醤油、酒粕、油脂など高い浸透圧を生じたり水素イオン指数を下げる効果を持つ、あるいは空気と遮断する効果を持つ漬け込み材料とともに漬け込み、保存性を高めるとともに熟成させ、風味を良くした保存食品。
sen.e: Tsukemono is preserved food that vegetables (fish or meat, sometimes) are pickled together with pickling ingredients having high osmotic pressure, having an effect to decrease hydrogen-ion exponent or having an effect to shut off from the air such as salt, vinegar, rice-bran paste, soy sauce, sake lees or fat and oil, to improve preservation quality as well as to improve taste and flavor by maturing.

Tsukemono is preserved food that vegetables (fish or meat, sometimes) are pickled together with pickling ingredients having high osmotic pressure, having an effect to decrease hydrogen-ion exponent or having an effect to shut off from the air such as salt, vinegar, rice-bran paste, soy sauce, sake lees or fat and oil, to improve preservation quality as well as to improve taste and flavor by maturing.

Tsukemono is preserved food that vegetables (fish or meat, sometimes) are pickled together with pickling ingredients having high osmotic pressure, having an effect to decrease hydrogen-ion exponent or having an effect to shut off from the air such as salt, vinegar, rice-bran paste, soy sauce, sake lees or fat and oil, to improve preservation quality as well as to improve taste and flavor by maturing.

sen.j: しばしば乳酸発酵などの発酵と、それによる保存性や食味の向上が伴う。
sen.e: It often involves fermentation such as lactic fermentation, and improvement of preservation quality and eating quality by the fermentation.
It often involves fermentation such as lactic fermentation, and consequently the improvement of preservation quality and eating quality by the fermentation.
It often involves fermentation such as lactic fermentation, and consequently the improvement of preservation quality and eating quality by the fermentation.

sen.j: 発酵を伴うタイプの漬物は、材料に自然に付着している乳酸菌と材料に含まれる糖類によって発酵し、保存性と風味の向上が起こるが、麹などを添加して発酵の基質となる糖類を増やしたり、そこに含まれる酵素によって風味を向上させる酵素反応を誘導することもある。
sen.e: Tsukemono with fermentation is fermented by lactic bacterium naturally attached to the ingredients and sugars included in the ingredients, which improves preservation quality, and taste and flavor, and sugars as ground substance for fermentation may be increased by adding rice malt, and oxygen reaction to improve taste and flavor may be induced by the enzyme included in rice malt.

Tsukemono with fermentation is fermented by the lactic bacterium naturally attached to the ingredients and the sugars included in the ingredients, which enhance the quality of preservation, taste and flavor; moreover, sugars as ground substances for fermentation can be increased by adding rice malt, and the oxygen reaction needed to improve taste and flavor can be induced by the enzyme contained in rice malt.

Tsukemono with fermentation is fermented by the lactic bacterium naturally attached to the ingredients and the sugars included in the ingredients, which enhance the quality of preservation, taste and flavor; moreover, sugars as ground substances for fermentation can be increased by adding rice malt, and the oxygen reaction needed to improve taste and flavor can be induced by the enzyme contained in rice malt.

sen.j: 一方、実際には浅漬け、千枚漬け、松前漬け、砂糖漬け等、その製造に発酵をともなわないものも多くあり、漬物すなわち発酵食品と分類することは誤りである。
sen.e: On the other hand, there exist many without fermentation in its process including Asazuke, Senmaizuke, Matsumaezuke, Satozuke, so it is incorrect to classify Tsukemono simply as fermented food.

On the other hand, there are many that don't use fermentation in their respective processes, such as asazuke, senmaizuke, matsumaezuke and satozuke, so it is incorrect to classify Tsukemono simply as a fermented food.

Many others, however, don't use fermentation in their respective processes, such as Asazuke, Senmaizuke, Matsumaezuke and Satozuke, so it is incorrect to classify tsukemono simply as a fermented food.
sen.cmt: 漬物名を大文字にしました。Tsukemono→tsukemonoに変更しました。

sen.j: 発酵により、強い香りを発するものが多い。
sen.e: Many of them emit strong smell due to fermentation.
Many of them emit a strong aroma due to fermentation.
Many of them emit a strong aroma due to fermentation.

sen.j: このため、「香の物」、「お新香」とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: Therefore, it is also called 'Konomono (smell thing)' or 'Oshinko (new smell thing).'
Therefore, it is also called 'Konomono (smelly thing)' or 'Oshinko (new smelly thing).'
Therefore, it is also called 'Konomono (smelly thing)' or 'Oshinko (new smelly thing).'

sen.j: また、秋田県など一部の地方では「雅香」がなまった「がっこ」と呼ぶ。
sen.e: It is called 'gakko,' a corrupted word of 'gako (elegant smell)' in some regions such as Akita Prefecture.
It is called 'gakko,' a corrupted word of 'gako (elegant aroma),' in regions such as Akita Prefecture.
It is called 'gakko,' a corrupted word of 'gako (elegant aroma),' in regions such as Akita Prefecture.

sen.j: 日本の漬物の場合、乳酸菌による発酵は酸味が著しく強くならない程度に抑制されているものが多いが、中には柴漬けやすぐきのように強い酸味を持つものもある。
sen.e: Most Japanese Tsukemono have controlled fermentation by lactic bacterium not to be too sour, but some of them including Shibazuke and Suguki have a strong sour taste.
Most Japanese tsukemono use controlled fermentation by lactic bacterium so as not to be too sour, but some of them--including shibazuke and suguki--have a strong sour taste.
Most Japanese tsukemono use controlled fermentation via lactic bacterium so as not to be too sour, but some of them--including Shibazuke and Suguki--have a strong, sour taste.
sen.cmt: 漬物名を大文字にしました。Tsukemono→tsukemonoに変更しました。

sen.j: ヨーロッパのザウアークラウトも、この類である。
sen.e: Sauerkraut of Europe is the same sort.
The German sauerkraut is of the same sort.
The sauerkraut of Germany is of the same sort.
sen.cmt: 主語を原稿どおりの「ヨーロッパのザウアークラウト」にしました。

sen.j: 漬物の技術は、乳酸菌発酵を十分に行うと野菜のみならず、動物質の保存にも有効となり、こうしたものはなれずしに分類される。
sen.e: With sufficient lactic fermentation, the technique of Tsukemono is efficient not only to vegetables but also preservation of animal matters, which is classified with Narezushi.
With sufficient lactic fermentation, the technique of tsukemono is efficient not only for vegetables but also for the preservation of animal matter, which is classified together with narezushi.
With sufficient lactic fermentation, the technique of tsukemono is efficient not only for vegetables but also for the preservation of animal matter, which is classified together with nare-zushi.
sen.cmt: 漬物名を大文字に。なれずし＝「Nare-zushi」はハイフンを追加しました。Tsukemono→tsukemonoに変更しました。

sen.j: 鮒寿司、ハタハタ寿司、エスキモーのキビヤックなどである。
sen.e: It includes Funa-zushi, Hatahata-zushi and Kiviak of Eskimo.
It includes funa-zushi, hatahata-zushi and the Eskimo kiviak.
It includes Funa-zushi, Hatahata-zushi and the Eskimo Kiviak.
sen.cmt: 漬物名を大文字にしました。

sen.j: 鮒寿司などの名前の「寿司」は、本来は発酵基質の糖質として炊き上げた米などの穀物を使用するこうした保存食を意味する言葉で、酢飯に魚を乗せる型のものはごく最近になって即席の寿司として誕生した新しいものである。
sen.e: The word 'sushi' in Funa-zushi originally means such preserved food using grain including cooked rice as carbohydrate, fermentation substance, and the type to put fish on vinegared rice was newly born only recently as instant sushi.

The word 'sushi' in "funa-zushi" originally meant such preserved food using grain, including cooked rice as carbohydrate, fermentation substance, but the type to put fish on vinegared rice was newly born only recently as "instant sushi."

The word 'sushi' in "Funa-zushi" originally meant such preserved food using grain (including cooked rice) as the carbohydrate (i.e., the fermentation substance), but the type to put fish on vinegared rice has emerged only recently as "instant sushi."
sen.cmt: 漬物名を大文字にしました

sen.j: 沢庵漬けのような糠漬けや、糠味噌床も、なれ寿司の穀物を乳酸発酵の基質として利用する技術の延長線上にあり、北陸の「へしこ」や北海道の「糠鰊」などにその中間型を見ることができる。
sen.e: Nukazuke such as Takuwan-zuke or Nukamiso-doko is seen as an extension of the technique to make use of grain of Narezushi as substance of lactic fermentation, and 'Heshiko' in Hokuriku and 'Kasu Nishin' in Hokkaido are seen in between.

Nukazuke such as takuwan-zuke or nukamiso-doko is seen as an extension of the technique for making use of grain of narezushi as a substance of lactic fermentation; 'Heshiko' in Hokuriku and 'Kasu Nishin' in Hokkaido are seen as being in between.

Nukazuke such as Takuwan-zuke or Nukamiso-doko is seen as an extension of the technique for making use of grain of nare-zushi as a substance of lactic fermentation; 'Heshiko' in Hokuriku and 'Kasu Nishin' in Hokkaido are seen as being in between.
sen.cmt: なれずし＝「Nare-zushi」とハイフンを追加しました。

sen.j: 愛知県海部郡 (愛知県)甚目寺町には、日本に唯一漬物の神様としてカヤノヒメを祭った萱津神社がある。
sen.e: Ama-gun, Aichi PrefectureKayazu-jinja Shrine enshrining Kayanohime as the only Goddess of Tsukemono in Japan is in Jimokuji-cho (Aichi Prefecture).
Ama-gun, Aichi PrefectureKayazu-jinja Shrine enshrining Kayanohime as the only goddess of tsukemono in Japan is in Jimokuji-cho (Aichi Prefecture).
Ama-gun, Aichi PrefectureKayazu-jinja Shrine, which enshrines Kayanohime as the only goddess of tsukemono in Japan, is located in Jimokuji-cho (Aichi Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 漬物を大文字に。Tsukemono→tsukemonoに変更しました。

sen.j: 毎年8月21日に催される「香の物祭」には全国の漬物業者がお参りする。
sen.e: Tsukemono traders across the country visit the shrine on the day of 'Konomono Festival' held on the 21st August each year.
Tsukemono traders across the country visit the shrine on the day of the 'Konomono Festival,' which is held on August 21 each year.
Tsukemono traders across the country visit the shrine on the day of the 'Konomono Festival,' which is held on August 21 each year.

sen.j: 漬物組合では毎月21日を「漬物の日」と定めている。
sen.e: The Tsukemono association has designated the 21st of each month as 'Tsukemono Day.'
The Tsukemono Association has designated the 21st of each month as 'Tsukemono Day.'
The Tsukemono Association has designated the 21st of each month as 'Tsukemono Day.'

sen.j: なお、砂糖漬けについては、保存性から漬物と分類する場合もあれば、製造法や用途などから漬物ではなく菓子もしくは菓子材料と分類する場合もある。
sen.e: As for Satozuke, it can be classified as Tsukemono due to its preservation quality, and can be also classified as confectionery or confectionery ingredient, not Tsukemono, due to its procedure and application.

As for Satozuke, it can be classified as tsukemono due to its preservation quality, but it can also be classified as confectionery or confectionery ingredient (not tsukemono) due to its procedure and application.

Satozuke can be classified as a type of tsukemono due to its preservative qualities, but it can also be classified as a confectionery or a confectionery ingredient (not tsukemono) due to the method by which it is made and its uses.
sen.cmt: 文脈がやや混乱しているため全体的に修整。

sen.j: また、マグロやアンチョビに代表されるような油漬も広義の漬物とされることがある。
sen.e: And Aburazuke as typified by tuna and anchovy can be also classified as Tsukemono in a broad sense.
Aburazuke, as typified by tuna and anchovy, can also be classified as tsukemono in a broad sense.
Aburazuke, as typified by tuna and anchovy, can also be classified as tsukemono in a broad sense.
sen.cmt: 漬物を大文字に。Tsukemono→tsukemonoに変更しました。

tit.cmt: 漬物を大文字にしました。Tsukemono→tsukemonoに変更しました。

sen.j: ラッキョウ（甘酢漬け、醤油漬け）
キビヤック（カナダおよびアメリカ合衆国・アラスカ州のイヌイット）
